meanings.definition: The act of moving backward or returning to an earlier state.
meanings.sent1: The retrogression of technology has made life simpler for many people.
meanings.sent2: The country experienced a retrogression in its economic growth last year.
meanings.sent3: The retrogression of the clock made everyone think it was time to go home.
meanings.sent4: Her retrogression to her childhood home brought back memories of carefree days.
meanings.sent5: The retrogression of the river's flow symbolized a return to tranquility.

meanings.definition: A decline or deterioration in quality or performance.
meanings.sent1: The retrogression of the company's products led to a decrease in sales.
meanings.sent2: The retrogression of the building's structure was evident in its crumbling walls.
meanings.sent3: The retrogression of the comedian's jokes made the audience groan instead of laugh.
meanings.sent4: The retrogression of the garden's beauty was a stark reminder of neglect.
meanings.sent5: The retrogression of the athlete's skills was noticeable in the competition.
